questions.ocrQuestion:
Question: If \( \ln u=\frac{x^{3}+y^{3}}{3 x+4 y} \), then \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) is equal to
(a) \( 2 u \ln u \)
(b) \( u \ln u \)
(c) \( \frac{2}{u} \ln u \)
(d) \( \frac{1}{u} \ln u \)
questions.onlyq_text: Question: If \( \ln u=\frac{x^{3}+y^{3}}{3 x+4 y} \), then \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) is equal to
questions.sol_html: Soln. \( \quad z=\ln u=\frac{x^{3}+y^{3}}{3 x+4 y} \longrightarrow \) homogenous \( f_{n} \) of degree 2\[z(\alpha x, \alpha y)=\alpha^{2} \cdot z(x, y)\]\[\begin{array}{l}x \cdot \frac{\partial z}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial z}{\partial y}=2 z \\\Rightarrow x \cdot \frac{1}{u} \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \cdot \frac{1}{u} \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=2(\ln u) \\\Rightarrow x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=2 u \ln u\end{array}\]

questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( u(x, y)=x^{4} \tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)+\left(\frac{x^{5}+y^{5}}{x+y}\right) \), then \( x \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial v}{\partial y} \) is.
1. \( 4 \mathrm{u} \)
2. \( 12 \mathrm{u} \)
3. \( -4 \mathrm{u} \)
4. \( -12 \mathrm{u} \)
questions.onlyq_text: If \( u(x, y)=x^{4} \tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)+\left(\frac{x^{5}+y^{5}}{x+y}\right) \), then \( x \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial v}{\partial y} \) is.
questions.sol_html: Concept:Euler's theorem for homogeneous function of degree (n)\[x \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial v}{\partial y}=n u\]\( u(\lambda x, \lambda y)=\lambda^{n}(x, y), n \) is degree.Calculation:\[\begin{array}{l}u(x, y)=x^{4}\left[\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)+\left(\frac{1+\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)^{5}}{1+\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)}\right)\right] \\\mathrm{n}=4 \\\therefore x \frac{\partial v}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial v}{\partial y}=4 u\end{array}\]

questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( u=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)+\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \), then the value of \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) is
1. U
2. \( 2 \mathrm{u} \)
3. \( 3 \mathrm{u} \)
4. 0
questions.onlyq_text: If \( u=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)+\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \), then the value of \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) is
questions.sol_html: Explanation:\[\begin{array}{l}\text { If } u=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)+\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \\x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=? \\\frac{\partial u}{\partial x}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{1-\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)^{2}}} \times \frac{1}{y}+\frac{1}{1+\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)^{2}} \times y\left(\frac{-1}{x^{2}}\right) \\\frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=\frac{-1}{\sqrt{1-\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)^{2}}} \times\left(\frac{x}{y^{2}}\right)+\frac{1}{1+\left(\frac{1}{x}\right)^{2}} \times \frac{1}{x} \\x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=\frac{x}{y} \times \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)^{2}}}-x \times \frac{y}{x^{2}} \times \frac{1}{\left[1+\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)^{2}\right]} \\-y \times\left(\frac{x}{y^{2}}\right) \times \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)^{2}}}+y \times \frac{1}{x} \frac{1}{\left(1+\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)^{2}\right)} \\\therefore x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=0 \\\end{array}\]

questions.concept_html: Concept:Since \( z \) is a homogeneous function of \( x \), \( y \) of degree \( n \), we can use Euler's Theorem defined as:\[\mathrm{x} \frac{d \mathrm{z}}{\partial \mathrm{x}}+y \frac{\partial \mathrm{z}}{\partial \mathrm{y}}=\mathrm{nz}\]Now, \( z=f(u) \)\( \frac{\partial \mathrm{z}}{\partial \mathrm{x}}=\mathrm{f}^{\prime}(\mathrm{u}) \frac{\partial \mathrm{u}}{\partial \mathrm{x}} \), and\[\frac{\partial \mathrm{z}}{\partial \mathrm{y}}=\mathrm{f}^{\prime}(\mathrm{u}) \frac{\partial \mathrm{u}}{\partial \mathrm{y}}\]Substituting this in Equation (1), we get:\[\mathrm{xf}^{\prime}(\mathrm{u}) \frac{\partial \mathrm{u}}{\partial \mathrm{x}}+\mathrm{yf}^{\prime}(\mathrm{u}) \frac{\partial \mathrm{u}}{\partial \mathrm{y}}=\mathrm{nf}(\mathrm{u})\]\[x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=n \frac{f(u)}{f^{\prime}(u)}\]
questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( u=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{x+y}{\sqrt{x}+\sqrt{y}}\right) \) then by Euler's theorem, \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) equals to
1. \( \frac{1}{2} \sin u \)
2. \( \frac{1}{2} \tan u \)
3. \( x+y \)
4. \( \sin x+\sin y \)
questions.onlyq_text: If \( u=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{x+y}{\sqrt{x}+\sqrt{y}}\right) \) then by Euler's theorem, \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) equals to
questions.sol_html: Given:\[\mathrm{u}=\sin ^{-1}\left(\frac{\mathrm{x}+\mathrm{y}}{\sqrt{\mathrm{x}}+\sqrt{\mathrm{y}}}\right)\]\( \mathrm{u} \) is not a homogenous function.\[\begin{array}{l}z=\sin u=\frac{x+y}{\sqrt{x}+\sqrt{y}} \\z=\frac{x\left(1+\frac{y}{x}\right)}{\sqrt{x}\left(1+\frac{\sqrt{y}}{\sqrt{x}}\right)} \\z=x^{\frac{1}{2}} \phi\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \\f(u)=\tan u\end{array}\]Now, \( z \) is a homogeneous function of \( x \) and \( y \) of degree \( 1 / 2 \).Since \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=n \frac{f(u)}{f^{\prime}(u)} \), we can write:\[\begin{array}{l}x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=\frac{1}{2} \times \frac{\sin u}{\cos u} \\x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=\frac{1}{2} \tan u\end{array}\]

questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( u=x^{n-1} y f\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \) then \( \frac{x \partial^{2} u}{\partial x^{2}}+\frac{y \partial^{2} u}{\partial y \partial x} \) is equal to
1. \( (n-1) \frac{\partial u}{\partial x} \)
2. \( (n-1) \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \)
3. nu
4. \( n(n-1) u \)
questions.onlyq_text: If \( u=x^{n-1} y f\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \) then \( \frac{x \partial^{2} u}{\partial x^{2}}+\frac{y \partial^{2} u}{\partial y \partial x} \) is equal to
questions.sol_html: We have:\[\begin{array}{l}u=x^{n-1} \cdot y f\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \\u=x^{n} \cdot\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) f\left(\frac{y}{x}\right)\end{array}\]\( u \) is a homogenous function of degree \( n \).\[x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=n u\]Now differentiate partially w.r.t. x again, we get:\[\begin{array}{l}x \frac{\partial^{2} u}{\partial x}+\frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial^{2} u}{\partial x \partial y}=n\left(\frac{\partial u}{\partial x}\right) \\\therefore x \frac{\partial^{2} u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial^{2} u}{\partial x \partial y}=(n-1) \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}\end{array}\]

questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( u=\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y^{3}-x^{3}}{x^{2}+y^{2}+x y}\right) \) the value of \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) at \( \mathrm{x}=1 \) and \( \mathrm{y}=3 \) is
1. 0.6
2. 0.4
3. 0.8
4. 1.2
questions.onlyq_text: If \( u=\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y^{3}-x^{3}}{x^{2}+y^{2}+x y}\right) \) the value of \( x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y} \) at \( \mathrm{x}=1 \) and \( \mathrm{y}=3 \) is
questions.sol_html: \[\begin{array}{l}u=\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{y^{3}-x^{3}}{x^{2}+y^{2}+x y}\right) \\\tan u=\frac{y^{3}-x^{3}}{x^{2}+y^{2}+x y}=\frac{(y-x)\left(x^{2}+y^{2}+x y\right)}{\left(x^{2}+y^{2}+x y\right)}\end{array}\]Now,\( \tan u=y\left[1-\left(\frac{x}{y}\right)\right] \) is a homogeneous function of degree ' 1 '\[\begin{array}{l}\therefore x \frac{\partial u}{\partial x}+y \frac{\partial u}{\partial y}=\frac{n f(u)}{f^{\prime}(u)}=1 \times \frac{\tan u}{\sec ^{2} u} \\=\frac{\tan u}{1+\tan ^{2} u}=\frac{(y-x)}{1+(y-x)^{2}} \\=\frac{(3-1)}{1+(3-1)^{2}}=\frac{2}{5}=0.4\end{array}\]
